definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: The limits of the Moon's penumbral shadow define the region of visibility of the partial eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 半影区的界限详细定义了日偏食的可视区域。

sentences.english: When the moon takes a bite-size chunk out of the sun, it's a partial solar eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 如果月球挡住太阳的一小部分，会产生日偏食。

sentences.english: However, almost all of Asia will be in a position to watch a partial eclipse of the sun .
sentences.chinese: 不过，几乎在亚洲的各个地方都能看到日偏食。

sentences.english: During a partial solar eclipse, only part of the sun is blotted out. (36 images)
sentences.chinese: 日偏食则意味着只有部分日面被遮住。

sentences.english: A partial eclipse will be visible as far south as northern Australia and as far north as Siberia, he said.
sentences.chinese: 南至北部澳大利亚，北至斯伯利亚都能观察到日偏食。

sentences.english: The further east the event tracked, the closer it got to local sunset.
sentences.chinese: 越往东，日偏食发生的时间越接近日落。

sentences.english: The Tuesday eclipse was the first of four partial solar eclipses in 2011.
sentences.chinese: 本周二的日食是2011年四次日偏食中的第一场。

definition: an annular eclipse of the sun
